body:
When a user uses a service, they submit data by:

* answering questions 
* uploading files

## Users’ answers

These are stored as a JSON document.

In a production environment:

* data is encrypted and transferred to and from a shared database via a secure connection
* each service has its own keys and namespace
* you can configure the keys in Publisher

In a non-production environment:

* the default storage mode is in-memory and non-persistent
* you will have an option in future to enable persistent storage

## Uploaded files

In a production environment:

* files are stored on a secure Amazon Web Services (AWS bucket

In a non-production environment:

* files are stored in the uploads directory in the root of the Runner app
heading: How Form Builder handles users’ data
